name: Crowdsale

@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
account.
@dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.

attributes.documentation:
@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.

attributes.documentation:
Abstract contract that allows children to implement an
emergency stop mechanism. Differs from Pausable by causing a throw when in halt mode.
attributes.name: Haltable

attributes.documentation: Math operations with safety checks

attributes.documentation:
Interface for the standard token.
Based on https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-20-token-standard.md

This function should the Minted event.

attributes.documentation: Token supply got increased and a new owner received these tokens

attributes.documentation:
Atomic increment of approved spending
   * Works around https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

Atomic decrement of approved spending.
   * Works around https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

attributes.documentation: @dev Provides an internal function for destroying tokens. Useful for upgrades.
attributes.name: burnTokens

attributes.documentation: @dev Provides an internal minting function.
attributes.name: mintInternal

attributes.documentation: Define interface for releasing the token transfer after a successful crowdsale.
attributes.name: ReleasableToken

attributes.documentation:
Set the contract that can call release and make the token transferable.
   * Since the owner of this contract is (or should be) the crowdsale,
it can only be called by a corresponding exposed API in the crowdsale contract in case of input error.
attributes.name: setReleaseAgent

attributes.documentation: Owner can allow a particular address (e.g. a crowdsale contract) to transfer tokens despite the lock up period.
attributes.name: setTransferAgent

attributes.documentation:
One way function to release the tokens into the wild.
   * Can be called only from the release agent that should typically be the finalize agent ICO contract.
In the scope of the crowdsale, it is only called if the crowdsale has been a success (first milestone reached).
attributes.name: releaseTokenTransfer

attributes.documentation: Limit token transfer until the crowdsale is over.
attributes.name: canTransfer

attributes.documentation: The function can be called only before or after the tokens have been released
attributes.name: inReleaseState

attributes.documentation: The function can be called only by a whitelisted release agent.
attributes.name: onlyReleaseAgent

attributes.documentation: We restrict transfer by overriding it
attributes.name: transfer

attributes.documentation: We restrict transferFrom by overriding it
attributes.name: transferFrom

attributes.documentation:
Upgrade agent transfers tokens to a new contract.
Upgrade agent itself can be the token contract, or just a middle man contract doing the heavy lifting.
 * The Upgrade agent is the interface used to implement a token
migration in the case of an emergency.
The function upgradeFrom has to implement the part of the creation
of new tokens on behalf of the user doing the upgrade.
 * The new token can implement this interface directly, or use.
attributes.name: UpgradeAgent

attributes.documentation: Interface to ensure the contract is correctly configured
attributes.name: isUpgradeAgent

attributes.documentation:
Upgrade an account
When the token contract is in the upgrade status the each user will
have to call `upgrade(value)` function from UpgradeableToken.
The upgrade function adjust the balance of the user and the supply
of the previous token and then call `upgradeFrom(value)`.
The UpgradeAgent is the responsible to create the tokens for the user
in the new contract.
@param from Account to upgrade.
@param value Tokens to upgrade.
attributes.name: upgradeFrom

attributes.documentation: A token upgrade mechanism where users can opt-in amount of tokens to the next smart contract revision.
attributes.name: UpgradeableToken

attributes.documentation: Somebody has upgraded some of his tokens.
attributes.name: Upgrade

attributes.documentation: New upgrade agent available.
attributes.name: UpgradeAgentSet

attributes.documentation: Do not allow construction without upgrade master set.
Allow the token holder to upgrade some of their tokens to a new contract.
attributes.name: upgrade

attributes.documentation: Set an upgrade agent that handles the upgrade process
attributes.name: setUpgradeAgent

attributes.documentation: Get the state of the token upgrade.
attributes.name: getUpgradeState

attributes.documentation:
Change the upgrade master.
   * This allows us to set a new owner for the upgrade mechanism.
attributes.name: changeUpgradeMaster

attributes.documentation: Internal upgrade master setter.
attributes.name: setUpgradeMaster

attributes.documentation: Child contract can override to provide the condition in which the upgrade can begin.
attributes.name: canUpgrade

attributes.documentation: Authored by https://www.coinfabrik.com/
attributes.name: LostAndFoundToken

attributes.documentation: @return Address of the account that handles movements.
attributes.name: getLostAndFoundMaster
enableLostAndFound

attributes.documentation:
A public interface to increase the supply of a token.
 * This allows uncapped crowdsale by dynamically increasing the supply when money pours in.
Only mint agents, usually contracts whitelisted by the owner, can mint new tokens.
attributes.name: MintableToken

attributes.documentation:
Create new tokens and allocate them to an address.
   * Only callable by a mint agent (e.g. crowdsale contract).
attributes.name: mint

attributes.documentation: Owner can allow a crowdsale contract to mint new tokens.
attributes.name: setMintAgent

attributes.documentation: Make sure we are not done yet.
attributes.name: canMint

attributes.documentation:
A crowdsale token.
 * An ERC-20 token designed specifically for crowdsales with investor protection and further development path.
 * - The token transfer() is disabled until the crowdsale is over
- The token contract gives an opt-in upgrade path to a new contract
- The same token can be part of several crowdsales through the approve() mechanism
- The token can be capped (supply set in the constructor) or uncapped (crowdsale contract can mint new tokens)
- ERC20 tokens transferred to this contract can be recovered by a lost and found master
attributes.name: CrowdsaleToken

attributes.documentation: When token is released to be transferable, prohibit new token creation.
attributes.name: releaseTokenTransfer

attributes.documentation: Allow upgrade agent functionality to kick in only if the crowdsale was a success.
attributes.name: canUpgrade

attributes.documentation:
Abstract base contract for token sales.
 * Handles
- start and end dates
- accepting investments
- various statistics during the crowdfund
- different investment policies (require server side customer id, allow only whitelisted addresses)
attributes.name: GenericCrowdsale

attributes.documentation:
Default fallback behaviour is to call buy.
Ideally, no contract calls this crowdsale without supporting ERC20.
However, some sort of refunding function may be desired to cover such situations.

Make an investment.
   * The crowdsale must be running for one to invest.
We must have not pressed the emergency brake.
   * @param receiver The Ethereum address who receives the tokens
@param customerId (optional) UUID v4 to track the successful payments on the server side
attributes.name: investInternal

attributes.documentation:
Preallocate tokens for the early investors.
   * Preallocated tokens have been sold before the actual crowdsale opens.
This function mints the tokens and moves the crowdsale needle.
   * No money is exchanged, as the crowdsale team already have received the payment.
   * @param receiver Account that receives the tokens.
@param fullTokens tokens as full tokens - decimal places are added internally.
@param weiPrice Price of a single indivisible token in wei.
attributes.name: preallocate

attributes.documentation:
Preallocate tokens for the early investors.
   * Preallocated tokens have been sold before the actual crowdsale opens.
This function mints the tokens and moves the crowdsale needle.
   * No money is exchanged, as the crowdsale team already have received the payment.
   * @param receiver Account that receives the tokens.
@param tokenAmount Indivisible tokens.
@param weiAmount Equivalent of tokens in wei.
attributes.name: granularPreallocate

attributes.documentation: Private function to update accounting in the crowdsale.
attributes.name: updateInvestorFunds

attributes.documentation:
Investing function that recognizes the receiver and verifies he is allowed to invest.
   * @param customerId UUIDv4 that identifies this contributor
attributes.name: buyOnBehalfWithSignedAddress

attributes.documentation:
Investing function that recognizes the receiver.

   * @param customerId UUIDv4 that identifies this contributor
attributes.name: buyOnBehalfWithCustomerId

attributes.documentation:
Buys tokens on behalf of an address.
   * Pay for funding, get invested tokens back in the receiver address.
attributes.name: buyOnBehalf

attributes.documentation:
Investing function that recognizes the payer and verifies he is allowed to invest.
   * @param customerId UUIDv4 that identifies this contributor
attributes.name: buyWithSignedAddress

attributes.documentation:
Investing function that recognizes the payer.

   * @param customerId UUIDv4 that identifies this contributor
attributes.name: buyWithCustomerId

attributes.documentation:
The basic entry point to participate in the crowdsale process.
   * Pay for funding, get invested tokens back in the sender address.
attributes.name: buy

attributes.documentation:
Finalize a successful crowdsale.
   * The owner can trigger post-crowdsale actions, like releasing the tokens.
Note that by default tokens are not in a released state.
attributes.name: finalize

attributes.documentation: Set policy do we need to have server-side customer ids for the investments.
attributes.name: setRequireCustomerId

attributes.documentation:
Set policy if all investors must be cleared on the server side first.
   * This is e.g. for the accredited investor clearing.
attributes.name: setRequireSignedAddress

attributes.documentation: Allow addresses to do early participation.
attributes.name: setEarlyParticipantWhitelist

attributes.documentation: Internal setter for the multisig wallet
attributes.name: setMultisig

attributes.documentation:
Crowdfund state machine management.
   * This function has the timed transition builtin.
So there is no chance of the variable being stale.
attributes.name: getState

attributes.documentation: Interface for the concrete instance to interact with the token contract in a customizable way
attributes.name: assignTokens

attributes.documentation: Determine if the goal was already reached in the current crowdsale
attributes.name: isCrowdsaleFull

attributes.documentation:
Returns any excess wei received

   * This function can be overriden to provide a different refunding method.
attributes.name: returnExcedent

attributes.documentation:
Calculate the amount of tokens that corresponds to the received amount.
 The wei amount is returned too in case not all of it can be invested.
   *  Note: When there's an excedent due to rounding error, it should be returned to allow refunding.
 This is worked around in the current design using an appropriate amount of decimals in the FractionalERC20 standard.
 The workaround is good enough for most use cases, hence the simplified function signature.
 @return weiAllowed The amount of wei accepted in this transaction.
 @return tokenAmount The tokens that are assigned to the receiver in this transaction.
attributes.name: calculateTokenAmount

attributes.documentation: Modifier allowing execution only if the crowdsale is currently running.
attributes.name: notFinished

attributes.documentation:
@dev Tranche based pricing.
      Implementing "first price" tranches, meaning, that if a buyer's order is
      covering more than one tranche, the price of the lowest tranche will apply
      to the whole order.
attributes.name: TokenTranchePricing

attributes.type: struct TokenTranchePricing.Tranche storage ref[] storage ref

attributes.documentation: @dev Construction, creating a list of tranches
attributes.name: configurationTokenTranchePricing

attributes.type: struct TokenTranchePricing.Tranche storage ref[] storage ref

attributes.name: getCurrentTranche

struct TokenTranchePricing.Tranche storage ref[] storage ref

attributes.name: getCurrentPrice

attributes.type: function (uint256) view returns (struct TokenTranchePricing.Tranche storage pointer)

attributes.documentation:
Finalize a successful crowdsale.
   * The owner can trigger post-crowdsale actions, like releasing the tokens.
Note that by default tokens are not in a released state.
attributes.name: finalize

attributes.documentation:
This function decides who handles lost tokens.
Do note that this function is NOT meant to be used in a token refund mecahnism.
Its sole purpose is determining who can move around ERC20 tokens accidentally sent to this contract.
attributes.name: getLostAndFoundMaster

attributes.documentation: @param new_minimum New minimum amount of indivisible tokens to be required
attributes.name: setMinimumBuyValue
